last_rotated_at.comment: When crypto was last upgraded to current policy version

next_rotation_due.comment: When user should be notified to rotate passphrase/policy

vault_id.comment: Reference to vault - links events to user's vault

kdf_iterations.comment: Number of KDF iterations for PBKDF2

deprecated_date.comment: When this policy is deprecated (NULL if current)

migration_deadline.comment: When old version is no longer accepted

vault_id.comment: Reference to vault - links recovery codes to user's vault

code.comment: Recovery code in format XXXX-XXXX-XXXX (alphanumeric, 14 chars)

used.comment: Whether this recovery code has been used (one-time only)

used_at.comment: When recovery code was used (if ever)

created_by.comment: User ID who generated the code (admin or vault owner)

constraints.comment: Each recovery code is unique per vault

records.title: Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
records.description: Build social confidence by repeating approach behaviors while anxious and dropping "make myself small" safety behaviors. Success = I stayed present and took normal space, not "I felt confident."

records.title: Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
records.description: Retrain my nervous system to move freely at raves while sober by interrupting stiffening, redirecting attention outward, and doing controlled "embarrassment exposures."

records.title: Dating Presence (Connection Over Performance)
records.description: Improve dating confidence by staying present, showing preferences, escalating gently, and tolerating awkwardness without self-correction or checking for approval.

records.title: Anti-Shrinking Week (Body Takes Normal Space)
records.description:
For 7-14 days, identify 2 "shrinking" safety behaviors and drop them on purpose (examples: quiet voice, hunching, apologizing, over-smiling, compressing arms). Track reps; success is compliance, not comfort.

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Duration:** 1-2 weeks
**Success Criteria:** Complete minimum 10 reps of anti-shrinking behaviors

records.title: 12 Social Openers (Tiny Starts)
records.description:
Complete 12 micro-interactions (friends, strangers, staff, coworkers): one opener + one follow-up question. Leave the interaction without evaluating performance.

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Duration:** 1-2 weeks
**Success Criteria:** 12 completed micro-interactions

records.title: Embarrassment Tolerance Training (No Fixing)
records.description:
Do 8 deliberate "mild awkward" reps (ask a simple question, admit slight nerves, let silence happen, make a slightly bold compliment). Do not repair, explain, or backpedal. Stay present through the discomfort.

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Duration:** 2-4 weeks
**Success Criteria:** 8 embarrassment tolerance reps completed

records.title: Sober Movement Conditioning (7 Songs)
records.description:
Move continuously for 7 full songs across the quest (alone or in public). No mirror. No judging. The goal is "continuous movement," not dance quality.

**Linked Goal:** Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
**Duration:** 1-4 weeks
**Success Criteria:** 7 full songs with continuous movement

records.title: Rave Reset Mastery (Stiffness -> Release Sequence)
records.description:
Practice and deploy a 20-second reset when stiffness appears: jaw drop + exhale; shoulder roll x2; hip sway 4 counts; resume movement. Do this 10 times across practice or real events.

**Linked Goal:** Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
**Duration:** 1-4 weeks
**Success Criteria:** 10 completed reset sequences

records.title: Dating Reps (3 Invites + 2 Dates)
records.description:
Send 3 low-pressure invites and complete 2 in-person dates/hangouts. Focus on presence + showing preferences, not being impressive.

**Linked Goal:** Dating Presence (Connection Over Performance)
**Duration:** 2-4 weeks
**Success Criteria:** 3 invites sent + 2 dates completed

records.name: Social Rep (Approach While Anxious)
records.description:
Do one approach behavior despite discomfort (start convo, join group, send invite, ask someone about themselves). Log a single sentence: "What I did."

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Target:** 3x per week

records.name: Drop One Safety Behavior (Anti-Shrink)
records.description:
Choose 1 safety behavior today and do the opposite (speak 10% slower, shoulders open, no apologizing, don't hide hands, don't look down).

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Target:** 4x per week

records.name: Embarrassment Rep (No Repair)
records.description:
Do something mildly awkward on purpose and do not "fix" it (no explaining, no over-talking, no apology). Stay in the interaction 20-60 seconds.

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Target:** 2x per week

records.name: One Preference Spoken (Micro-Assertiveness)
records.description:
State one preference out loud (food, music, plan, opinion). Short. No justification.

**Linked Goal:** Social Confidence Through Reps (No Shrinking)
**Target:** 3x per week

records.name: Continuous Movement Song (No Mirror)
records.description:
Put on one song and move continuously until it ends. The only rule: keep moving.

**Linked Goal:** Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
**Target:** 4x per week

records.name: Stiffness Reset Drill (20 seconds)
records.description:
Practice: jaw drop + exhale; shoulder roll x2; hip sway 4 counts; resume. Count it as done when you complete the sequence.

**Linked Goal:** Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
**Target:** 5x per week

records.name: Outward Attention Loop (Sound/Light/Body)
records.description:
For 60 seconds, rotate attention: bass -> lights -> feet/weight. If you catch self-monitoring, restart the loop.

**Linked Goal:** Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
**Target:** 5x per week

records.name: Controlled "Too Much" Move (Disinhibition Rep)
records.description:
For 10 seconds, intentionally move bigger than comfortable (arms, shoulders, head). Stay present after.

**Linked Goal:** Sober Rave Freedom (Disinhibition Without Substances)
**Target:** 2x per week

records.name: Send One Invite
records.description:
Invite someone to something simple (coffee, walk, show, event). Low pressure.

**Linked Goal:** Dating Presence (Connection Over Performance)
**Target:** 1x per week

records.name: 2-Step Conversation (Ask + Follow-up)
records.description:
Ask one open question, then one follow-up about a detail. Do not pivot to performance.

**Linked Goal:** Dating Presence (Connection Over Performance)
**Target:** 4x per week

records.name: Warmth Signal (Compliment or Appreciation)
records.description:
Give one sincere compliment/appreciation to a friend/date. One sentence.

**Linked Goal:** Dating Presence (Connection Over Performance)
**Target:** 2x per week

records.name: Tiny Vulnerability (One Honest Sentence)
records.description:
Share one small honest thing ("I'm a bit tired today," "I get nervous sometimes," "I'm excited about this"). No over-explaining.

**Linked Goal:** Dating Presence (Connection Over Performance)
**Target:** 2x per week

records.name: Catcow on hands and knees
records.description:
General warm-up for spine.

Key cues: Start neutral; gently round then extend; move with slow breathing.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RKN24fpS-as

records.name: Half-kneeling hip-flexor stretch
records.description:
Primary hip-flexor stretch to reduce anterior tilt.

Key cues: Posteriorly tilt pelvis; squeeze glute on back leg; do not arch low back.
Guide: https://youtu.be/_xU-wIiMxpI?si=3gzdQi19tQCYRrIB

records.name: Standing or side-lying quad stretch
records.description:
Targets rectus femoris which is often tight in anterior tilt.

Key cues: Keep pelvis lightly tucked; bring heel toward glute; avoid pulling low back into arch.
Guide: https://youtu.be/_xU-wIiMxpI?si=aUz39djZMQNdG9DX

records.name: Supine hamstring stretch
records.description:
Improves hamstring flexibility if they feel tight.

Key cues: Lie on back; keep opposite leg straight on floor; raise leg until stretch not pain.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Il1L75v6gq0a

records.name: Child's pose with posterior pelvic tilt focus
records.description:
Encourages lumbar flexion to counter constant extension.

Key cues: Sit hips toward heels; gently round low back; relax shoulders.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZX_zTOBgp8

records.name: Thread the needle from hands and knees
records.description:
Improves thoracic rotation and general upper back mobility.

Key cues: From quadruped slide arm under; rotate upper back; keep movement smooth and pain free.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7C8-zj3nRro

records.name: Foam-roller thoracic extension
records.description:
Improves thoracic extension and reduces stiffness.

Key cues: Roller across upper back; support head; gently extend over roller then return.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W_6_swxc-cI

records.name: Doorway pec stretch
records.description:
Opens tight chest and front shoulders that pull posture forward.

Key cues: Elbows at about shoulder height; step through door until chest stretch; do not push into shoulder pain.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M850sCj9LHQ

records.name: Supine pelvic tilt to neutral
records.description:
Trains control of pelvic position and awareness of neutral.

Key cues: Lie on back with knees bent; gently tilt pelvis to flatten low back then arch slightly; find middle neutral.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U0dfnyfhpwk

records.name: Wall alignment drill
records.description:
Reinforces stacked neutral posture for daily standing.

Key cues: Heels a short distance from wall; butt and mid back on wall; gently draw ribs down and lightly tuck pelvis.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hQLU6m7GNwU

records.name: Joint circles (neck/shoulders/hips/ankles)
records.description:
General joint prep; reduces baseline bracing.

Key cues: Slow circles; stay pain-free; breathe normally.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6v7p7s6Kk4Y

records.name: World's greatest stretch (lunge + T-spine reach)
records.description:
Full-body opener; high carryover.

Key cues: Long exhale in the bottom; reach rotates from upper back.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fsa3n5g8fYI

records.name: 90/90 hip switches (controlled)
records.description:
Builds hip IR/ER control, not just stretch.

Key cues: Move slowly; stay tall; don't force knee down.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H9m3qTt7n3E

records.name: Pigeon pose (or figure-4 on back)
records.description:
Glute/hip external rotators.

Key cues: Hips square; ease off if knee pain.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2vPqM7q3QXo

records.name: Supine hamstring floss (band/towel)
records.description:
Flossing often transfers better than long static.

Key cues: Alternate gentle extend/bend; no nerve pain.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G3Zp6jPp3xM

records.name: Wall calf stretch (gastroc/soleus)
records.description:
Supports ankle range for squats/dance.

Key cues: Heel down; don't collapse arch.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yj3bQn9pVxg

records.name: Open book thoracic rotation
records.description:
Reduces upper back stiffness.

Key cues: Exhale as you open; keep knees stacked.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0uK4pYq1m1A

records.name: Wall slides (scap control)
records.description:
Shoulder mobility + control (less bracing).

Key cues: Ribs down; forearms stay on wall; slow.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z6Lw9xQw8lI

records.name: Doorway pec stretch (low + mid angle)
records.description:
Two angles improves transfer.

Key cues: No shoulder pain; gentle step-through.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SV7l1sfEmO0

records.name: Child's pose with side reach
records.description:
Good downshift finisher.

Key cues: Reach long; breathe into side ribs.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I8m3l9kV3Wg

records.name: Constructive rest breathing (knees bent)
records.description:
Locks in tension reduction / state change.

Key cues: Long exhale; jaw unclenched; shoulders heavy.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4pLUleLdwY4

records.name: Nasal breathing + jaw unclench check
records.description:
Downshifts bracing; sets baseline.

Key cues: Lips gently closed; tongue rests on palate; jaw hangs.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RzVvThhjAKw

records.name: Masseter release (gentle self-massage)
records.description:
Targets jaw clenching tension.

Key cues: Light pressure; slow circles; stop if sharp pain.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EM18snVgV_c

records.name: Controlled jaw open/close (midline)
records.description:
Motor control for jaw tracking.

Key cues: Open slowly; keep jaw tracking straight; no clicking.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7b73yE0U2t0

records.name: Chin tucks (deep neck flexors)
records.description:
Reduces forward-head tension that feeds face bracing.

Key cues: Glide head back; keep throat relaxed; breathe.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2jvB6K3pGxA

records.name: Smileneutral control reps
records.description:
Trains expressiveness without over-control.

Key cues: Slow smile to ~70%; relax fully back to neutral.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0TjGQw4h9iI

records.name: Brow raise + gentle squint combo
records.description:
Improves expressive range (upper face).

Key cues: Raise brows then add slight squint; relax fully.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6y2ZQp7a5iQ

records.name: Tongue posture drill (light)
records.description:
Supports jaw relaxation; do not force.

Key cues: Tongue on palate; jaw relaxed; nasal breathe.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Z_Fp9lGrGY

records.name: Speak one sentence with 3 expressions
records.description:
Transfers to real social expression control.

Key cues: Same sentence; change expression only; keep jaw loose.
Guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Hc9Yw6h2u0

records.name: Mobility: Posture Reset (APT + Upper Back)
records.description: Mobility routine targeting anterior pelvic tilt patterns and upper back/pec stiffness. Seeded from your posture table.

records.name: Mobility: Generic Flexibility + Tension Reduction
records.description: General mobility routine focused on usable range, reduced baseline tension, and breath-linked control (high transfer to movement/social comfort).

records.name: Mobility: Face + Expressiveness (Low-Tension Control)
records.description: Face/jaw/neck mobility + expressiveness drills aimed at reducing bracing and improving controlled facial range. Avoid pain/clicking; keep pressure gentle.

recovery_codes.name: idx_recovery_codes_vault_id
recovery_codes.comment: Lookup codes by vault (to fetch all codes for a vault)

recovery_codes.name: idx_recovery_codes_code
recovery_codes.comment: Lookup code by value (for validation during passphrase reset)

recovery_codes.name: idx_recovery_codes_unused
recovery_codes.comment: Efficiently find unused codes for a vault (filtered index optimization)

recovery_codes.name: idx_recovery_codes_used_at
recovery_codes.comment: Track usage timestamps for security audit logs

crypto_policies.name: idx_crypto_policies_effective_date
crypto_policies.comment: For querying current/active policies by date
